text: Before starting, I have to set up two ground rules. Two very important ground rules. First, it is very important for you

text: to be relaxed,

speaker: Michel Thomas

speaker: Michel Thomas
text: Before starting, the two ground rules that are very important.

speaker: Michel Thomas
text: The first ground rule is for you never to worry about remembering,

speaker: Michel Thomas
text: and therefore never to try to remember.

speaker: Michel Thomas
text: Because this is a method where the responsibility for your remembering is in the teaching and not with you. Not with the learner.

speaker: Michel Thomas

speaker: Michel Thomas
text: that in the course I'm using two students as a teaching device in order to create a learning situation for three. You'll become the third in the group,

speaker: Michel Thomas
text: and very quickly you will associate with the two on the tapes. You will become part of it. And it's very important, therefore, that after I introduce a concept,
